channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA

item.title: Report E-2024100348
item.description:
Report E-2024100348

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-16T09:16:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-20
  • City: NORTH HUNTINGDON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1627 ET, XPO-XPB notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported approximately 3 ounces of Armour last 1 released from a 5-gallon metal pail due to improper packaging. The release impacted inside trailer#311-7093. XPO informed us this was already cleaned up and placed into a 10-gallon metal drum along with Oil-Dri. The waste is staged for terminal personnel to manage.

ABF stated it looks like the drum had to have been punctured at the previous terminal by forks when being loaded. ABF stated the trailer floor has not been affected just the freight and cardboard.

item.title: Report X-2024100594
item.description:
Report X-2024100594

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-30
  • City: BETHLEHEM
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1. X-2024100594 RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT SPILL WITH PROPER PPE ON. LOOK AT PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. AFTER CLEAN UP, TRANSPORTED THE HAZMAT TO THE DMP FOR PROCESSING. 2. X-2024100595 RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO A HAZMAT LEAKER. ARRIVED IN PROPER PPE AND DECISION TREE IN HAND. AFTER LOOKING AT PACKAGE, FOLLOWED THE DECISION TREE FOR PROPER CLEAN UP. AFTER CLEANING UP, TRANSPORTED PACKAGE TO DMP FOR PROCCESING.

item.title: Report E-2024100311
item.description:
Report E-2024100311

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: t 0603 ET, XPO terminal XHG notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that an unknown amount of Momentive Silsoft ETS Fluid released from a 55-Gallon metal drum due to being punctured by loading strap. The release impacted area of Dock 109 to 153. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The terminal used oil dri as the absorbent and a 55-gallon drum for the waste. 95-gallon drum for overpack of the damaged drum.

item.title: Report E-2024100308
item.description:
Report E-2024100308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-19
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 03:39 EST on 9/19, XPO-XMI contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 25 gallons of "776 Inhibitor Solution" from a 55-gallon metal drum. The drum was punctured by a forklift at the XMI dock. The material is reported to be smoking on the dock. ERTS instructed the terminal personnel to leave the spill as-is, and not to interact with the material further. Any personnel with a potential for exposure should be removed from the area and exposures should be reported to the immediate supervisor. The contractors confirmed the spill is contained with oil dry, overpacked the 55-gallon metal drum into (1) 95-gallon metal drum, impacted speedy dri into (3) 55-gallon metal drums. The waste was staged for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024100310
item.description:
Report E-2024100310

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-12T21:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACV ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our driver loaded the drums into truck at the shipper's facility. Driver, after securing drums, failed to secure a loose pallet jack in the back of this truck. In transit, the pallet jack shifted and rolled into 1A1 steel drum containing antifreeze. Drum damage resulted in loss of 15 gallons of material into back of truck and onto private property of subsequent customer. Complete cleanup was conducted by our company, in-house.

item.title: Report E-2024100295
item.description:
Report E-2024100295

Identified by scraper @ 2024-10-11T09:22:09+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-03
  • City: PHILADELPHIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNA experienced a UN2735 Baxxodur EC301 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 30-gallons of Baxxodur EC301 released to a 100’ x 20’ area of the asphalt lot and a 15’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor. The drum was punctured by a metal plate which slid within the trailer during transport. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were then worked into the impacted areas to clean the release. The impacted absorbents were containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was removed from site for disposal.
